summary: Spoofs "The Hunger Games," "Avengers" and Harry Potter.

reviews.content: Look, if you're not in the mood for a stupid movie this sucks, it has no merit. But if you and you're friends want a stupid and silly movie to watch it's honestly so funny in the dumbest way possible. If it has the correct context it's amazing.
it was incredible hilarious would recommend for immature people like me go watch it tonight
Beautiful, the greatest movie of our generation. Truly inspirational.
if you didn't like this you are lying to yourself
absolutely fantastic, so long as you don't take it too seriously
I think that the so-called "Starving Games" is a really bad rip off of the "Hunger Games". If you want to watch something better I suggest you watch the Hunger Games.

Don't believe the comments that rate this movie 3/10 (or lower), this movie is a 7/10 at least, (10/10 from me). Individuals with such low rating have no sense of humor. This movie had me ROFL since the very beginning. The original Hunger Games movie was understandably too serious at certain parts of the film, such as "I Volunteer as Tribute scene". While watching this scene and others all I could think of "wouldn't it be funny if this and this happened". I'd share these thoughts with my friends and we would have a good laugh at the movie theater. What's interesting is some of the spoof movie ideas my friends and I had were portrayed in this movie, such as - what if two tributes were to enter a sexual intercourse in the Arena? Forget the life & death/ survival tools from sponsors such as spile or sleeping syrup. What if some sponsor were to send them condoms?? To have their romance take a completely different turn on live television. In a real world that's how it would happen. And such scene actually occurs in the Starving Games between the Katnis and Peeta parody characters. Hilarious. Watch this movie, on a bad day or if you really want a good laugh. 3/10 rating for this film is highly inaccurate and individuals that gave this review have no understanding of what spoof comedy is.

It was better than disaster movie (by a lot) it was still dumb as any spoof film by Jason Friedberg & Aaron Seltzer. It was funny at times still and I'd recommend if your down for watching a spoof movie and being high/drunk. It's just stupid-funny, but what'd you expect.
A hilarious parody of a great movie. However no the best effects.
If you are younger you'll definitely find it way funnier then an adult. It is more teenage comedy and I found it really funny to watch ´.

Hello! This Goofy Ahh Review was written by Lilratshat. I was forced to write this by berny sanders spy drones. It took 69 hours, so please don't IP ban me. Without further ado I present Lilratshats Starving games Review! (Pls Unban Sophia Mcshitty K thx)




The starving games are by far the worst movie I have EVER seen. Anyone who participated in this should really be ashamed. The starving games could be compared to a boiling steaming rotten runny pile of fresh shart. It's so bad, that I want to give myself 69 swirlies in a gas station bathroom and pretend I'm constipated by screaming my head off, so the whole neighborhood can hear my howls of pain after watching this movie. It was so bad, that I regret spending 91 minutes of my life watching this completely disgusting film. Really, what were the directors thinking… 

On the other hand, people who have watched or read the Hunger Games Movies and books may want to see more. The starving games are a remake of the original Hunger Games, but they are way better. It is like the original movie, but it has more humor and delightful moments, making it quite interesting over the old depressing hunger games. "I didn't get picked, I didn't get picked, No more Starving Games for me!!!". This movie is truly one of the best I have ever seen, and I recommend it for all ages.
The starving games is a movie about 24 kids who compete in the starving games for a great reward. The fight takes place in an arena, and the children are given weapons. The games are very unpredictable but are loved by the capital people. Children could be attacked by a wide range of creatures, or they could receive weapons ranging from guns to spears or swords. In the starving games, anything goes. The movie features some absolutely golden GEN-Z humor, which makes it a perfect fit. This is a spoof, so if you do not enjoy these types of things, I suggest you do not watch it

The story is about Kantpiss Evershot, who enters the games in place of her sister who she would protect at all costs. In the games, she meats the love of her life peter malarky. At home, her other love dale will do anything to break them apart, including entering the games and trying to kill peter. President snowballs also wants kantpiss dead, because he believes she will lead a revolution.
Even though the creators of this amazingly hilarious film were shunned, I still think this is by far the greatest movie to ever exist. Some people just don't understand the plot and the humor. This movie was purposely made to look bad, and I think it does a really good job of conveying that message to the public. Even as a spoof people hate it, but to me, it's really great. People may hate Jason Friedberg, Aaron Seltzer but I think they are extremely good at directing.

This movie is similar to other movies, but mostly the hunger games because it is a remake that is meant to be more funny and enjoyable. Some people say the original hunger games took inspiration from battle royal, even though the author has repeatedly denied it. Either way, it is pretty obvious that the starving games is a direct copy of the hunger games, except it has different humor, and gets a lot more hate.


Overall, I can understand why people hate this movie so much. The humor is extremely childish, which will most likely not entertain adults. Some parts of the movie are just plain bad. The quality is not the best, and there are some flaws and unneeded parts in the storyline. An example would be superheroes at the end who die within 3 minutes. Overall, it's pretty bad. But someone with screwed-up GEN-Z humor would absolutely love it. I think it's good, others may disagree.

This movie is absolute steaming shart but in the best way possible. While watching this movie i felt as if I was watching my ferret vomit out his own feces, this is an amazing movie. The jokes are elegant and I feel the need to run around screaming about how hilariously sussy this was. The acting is top notch, this is much better then the original. The original is actually a horrendous copy of this movie created by Putin's  team of spy drones. The sussy scenes in the movie are ultra realistic and I ship the rat found at 1:18 and the KatPiss (miss) together, they would make a great pair. In conclusion this movie is a cinematic masterpiece, I am so glad my Discord kitten reccomended we watch this because I was in awe at the time and effort put into this suspicious movie.
Super epic movie better than squid game
Absolute waste of my life. Movie references for no reason, and with a moderately based budget of just over 4 million dollars it still had no potential. Dissapointing, not funny at all.
The childish humor rears its ugly head right from the beginning and never grows up.
Probably the best movie of the 21st century
It was so Funny i couldn‘t stop laughting😆😆😆😆

comical heaven 
never laughed so hard at something so dumb 100% recommend

this shit was bussin. it was so funny i found myself searching around me for some hit man because i didnt feel like i was worthy enough to watch this film. youtube free with ads is the sexiest thing ever created.
It was so bad it's hilarious. Cringe inducing, but you can't stop watching like a train wreck. Low score for the movie, recommend watching it for the experience.

The cinematography was comically bad, but the directors played on the low budget to create a modern day slapstick comedy. The cheap laughs are reminiscent of the hunger games' own shortcomings as well as those of today's popular television.
Nothing new here.... Move along

I hate hunger games, but I love hungry
 games with passion, it has very good and funny characters and script, I love this movie and I watch it every day.
Idk why people hate this so much. I find it comical and sucky. Like it's suppose to be. If you say this film sucks then put a 3+ star. That's what the creators meant for it to be.
Unfunny, offensive, gross, dated, cliché, derivative, lazy, poorly acted, silly, ridiculous and overall terrible attempt to be a parody film that should have never been made.
Why? Why I do that to myself? Just... WHY?

Great film for a spoof. I didn't really like all the humour, innuendo and mocking the hunger games too much. Still I do NOT recommend this film that barely made me want to see it again. This film was one of the worst films I've ever watched in my life.
Never watch this. You'll waste 1:22:35 of your life.
Amazing so good better than hunger games by a hundredfold! We really need catching on fire and Mocking Jay
It's ridiculous, outrageous, and rather stupid, but there's enough weird, obnoxious humor to keep ME entertained, at least
a movie as beautiful as it is funny that has only and only useless and senseless scenes with a few really funny parts, for the most part it is boring
It does not make you laugh too much, although some laughs, but not the adequate ones and besides that when they want to put a reference they do it badly.
such a original movie, the ending made me cry though.

The usual horrible schlock from these two hacks. nothing is parodied but is only referenced. You've got people dressed up in costumes randomly walking in just so they can go "hey look! remember this here thing we're referencing?" and you have the typical witless fart and toilet jokes.

I wish these two would just go away already. Everyone hates you.
Best movie  ever!!!!! Better than the actual hunger games movies!! Highly recomend!
This movie is great! It is not meant for old movie critics and set out to win oscars. This is a good laugh for teens and is a hilarious take on the hunger games!
Lol This movie was so funny XD
I tortured myself watching this movie. UGH!
Not to be taken seriously.  Haven't laughed at a spoof like this since scary movie 3.

F+
At least 'The Starving Games' tries to satirize the tropes of the usual Blockbuster movie with 'Spaceballs' levels of merchandising meta-humor, gags at the ridiculousity of action team-ups ('The Avengers', 'The Expendables'), but it is so full of continuity errors that made me baffled over 'Epic Movie' (also directed by Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer), and has gags that barely earn a laugh.
This movie is great if you want to watch a movie that's funny because its so bad. If you want to watch an actually good movie then don't watch this.
Unfunny, unpleasant and unwatchable.
actually a pretty funny parody of The hunger games.
Funny and entertaining, everything a spoof should be

The Starving Games a mockup of The Hunger Games franchise is like all the other spoof comedy movies that make fun of the original. The movie is not great but its ok does justice to the original makes fun of all the right things.
Do I recommend it not really a movie that does not keep all your attention and you can have a nap in the middles of is not that great.
please stop making these kind of movies!!!!

60%     Those who enjoy the overly stupid, silly and ridiculous comedy that The Starving Games dishes out will find plenty to enjoy in this dumb-fest. Those who don't however, will find it is a comedy that is more irritating than funny.
oh my was this the opposite of a good parody
WOW why the middle finger
Half a star is the lowest rating it allows so
This was one of the worst parodies I have ever seen. It wasn't funny, it was cheap and it made no sense!

Well this settles it, I can't stand 90% of spoof movies. This had a few chuckles, but the rest wasn't clever or fun or funny or interesting. The costumes and lookalikes were the most interesting thing. I wasted 90 minutes of my life :(

Wow, what a horrible movie. Full of horrible bathroom gags, internet references bound to be outdated by 2017, and about as many laughs as a funeral. This movie would probably fail to make a 13 year old laugh. As if we needed more proof that cinematic parody is dead.

What I got to say about "The Starving Games" is an insulting in every meaning of the word, that's how bad this movie is. "It's not funny at all.. It's horrendous." The performances by the whole cast is awful. The directing and screenplay by Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer is unbelievable. The cinematography is okay but could have been much better. Finally, the score and effects are not good at all. "I have to report that "The Starving Games" is not worth watch at all."

This is by far one of the stupidest spoofs you'll ever see. Do you even consider this a movie? The jokes were unfunny, and the comedy was just plain immature. The acting was alright, though, but the characters were just stupid. Some spoof scenes tried way too hard to be funny, and even just kept dragging along, hoping the audience would laugh. To be honest, I don't recommend this god awful movie to anyone, because trust me: you don't want to watch it.

A parody for people who thought Hot Shots and Scary Movie were comic genius.  This one's just as much a satire of pop culture and America's social media obsession as it a play on Hunger Games.  Besides, any movie with Diedrich Bader is guaranteed for a few hard laughs.

I have grown tired of these reference movies that do nothing but make reference to pop culture, it's not funny to just reference it, you have to have fun with it. This movie did have it's pop culture references, but it also put fun twists on many things from the Hunger Games. I loved watching this movie, and I've already watched it a couple times more. I would recommend that it not be completely looked over as an average Friedberg and Seltzer movie, I think they're improving.

I wanted to understand why directors Friedberg and Seltzer have such a bad reputation. Now I know. "The Starving Games" is downright embarrassing for everyone involved in both the filming and viewing of this film. This is among the worst films I've ever seen and I've seen some notoriously bad films.

Horrible, but at least it's trying to be.  This film knows that it's supposed to suck, and at least embraces this idea openly.  And to its credit, from what I've seen in this, it does have a couple of moments that are genuinely funny.  But yeah, it sucks lol.

Not the best, I liked it as much as I liked Disaster Movie, but the jokes were going to be extremely obvious, like the middle finger joke, and they used stuff that was popular in 2012 (such as Angry Birds) and thought it would work.

This movie is is a stunning example of integrity and courage. It truly takes an intrepid soul to forge a masterpiece such as this. God have mercy on those who were born without souls, for they are the staunch detractors of this important film.
The Hunger Games has got to be the biggest travesty of our generation, and this parody, the scrappy underdog that it is, backs it into a corner and bloodies it up. In the end, the lead-poisoned populace will declare the winner to be The Hunger Games, but the two films know what happened on the battle field. They will both remember who held their ground in spite of all odds and who was valiant only in theory.
Unlike the Hunger Games, this film does not try to deceive you by making you feel like you're the only one intelligent enough to understand its social commentary, nor does it rely on the mass retrograde amnesia that made the world forget about The Running Man, Battle Royale, or Stone Cold Steve Austin's film that also shared this tired old concept. This film is unabashedly sincere. It is not afraid to take it's place in hell.
I implore all of the lonely, all of the oppressed, and all of the underdogs of the world to see this movie. Those who prefer to have the world against them will find solace in this film. It is a beacon of hope in a world that takes mediocrity much too seriously.
Cheap Cash Grab that does not deserve to be called a Film
Funnier and Juicer then expected. This was a good parody of the Hunger games.
This movie was really dumb and wasn't funny.

Probably worse than watching this movie is trying to come up with five sentences for a review. We all know the works of Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer. There was a time where I shamefully would tell you that I enjoyed these films in middle school. How did I? The humor is appalling in every aspect. It's always been lazy, disgusting, abhorrent, idiotic, and quite frankly not worth writing at all about. I picked this film for the scavenger hunt to see if any of the middle school of me resided in there. It died just like how Friedberg and Seltzer's movie careers should have been dead by now.

Terrible picture, terrible screenplay, terrible visual effects, terrible comedy, terrible..., terrible....

Everything is fcking nonsense, full of goofs, and illogical actions. Some scenes repeated (more than) two times.

The worst move I've ever watch. Really wasting my 91 minutes

i looks kinda low budget in some parts and the movie is not that funny
5 stars, because most people underrate this movie. I found this movie quite entertaining AND frankly it has more logic than the "hunger games" and far less plot holes.

digitally added googly eyes ..) but this movie was just spilling over
with joke after joke after joke, most of them lame, but honestly some

hard since I was a kid, 20+ years ago. This was a good comedy. And it
was a very bad movie. And a good movie. And I thought it was awful. I
recommend it.

Yeah, it's got some silly, funny moments in it. But let's not beat around the bush; this is yet another movie that was set out from the beginning to be a guilty pleasure piece of trash with juvenile pop-culture humor and cartoony gags. 
The effort in these kind of films is beyond lazy and we need to stop giving them attention, lest they continue to make more like this.

In this spoof, which is a much better version of The Hunger Games, Kantmiss Evershot (Maiara Walsh) must fight for her life in the 75th annual Starving Games, where she could also win an old ham, a coupon for a foot-long sub, and a partially eaten pickle.

also stars Brant Daugherty, Cody Christian, Ross Wyngaarden, Dean West, Deidrich Bader, Josep Aviel, Lauren Bowles and Nick Gomez.

directed by Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer.

My GF wanted to watch this, but had not seen the HG original. I insisted on seeing the HG first. We watched this the next night. I thought the Hg was based on a stupid premise and found this spoof the be somewhat stupid also... but hilarious in many places in pointing out how ridiculous the original was. As far as spoofs go, I thought it was well done and we actually laughed out loud many times. I would normally give it 3 stars, but will go 4 to bring up it's average. I would like to see the directors do another spoof soon (Django Unshackeled?)...
I laughed my butt off.its not supposed to be taken seriously,it's supposed to be stupid.
This movie has enough jokes to make up for its trash plot, but overall it falls into the "its so bad that its good territory".
So Dumb that I felt like Crying!
I loved it. it was so funny
The worst movie I have ever seen.
It was alright, I enjoyed the sattire...however, they were missing Haymitch. Where was Haymitch? He could have been the perv that hit on Kantmiss, Like. What??

Just another showcase of why the spoof movie genre needs to die.  While the first two Scary Movie films did their job the rest are less thought out (if that was even possible).  While there are a few laughs to be had I pity anyone who spent money to see this.

Before I watched "The Starving Games" last night, I had never before watched a parody film. And now, after having watched the aforementioned film (if one can even call it that), I probably never will again.

This so-called "comedy" now has the dubious distinction of being the only movie from said genre to fail at evoking so much as even a chuckle from me. This isn't so much a film, as it is a collection of gross-out gags, terrible special effects, and dated pop culture references.

If you're looking for a decent comedic plot, look elsewhere, because the plot of "The Starving Games" is basically non-existent. The only way the "plot" of this "film" will make any sort of sense is based on the viewer's prior knowledge of "The Hunger Games." The direction of the film is downright horrendous and it is a wonder that Aaron Seltzer and Jason Friedberg continue to make these atrocities. The dialogue is absolutely terrible and some of the cringe-inducing jokes are repeated ad nauseam. 

Never before has a movie had me cringing the entire time I watched it. However, if I had the ability to give this movie a zero out of ten, I wouldn't. The reason for that is because of Maiara Walsh, who plays our heroine Kantmiss Evershot. Despite being stuck in one of the worst "films" ever made, she has the potential to break free from this side of Hollywood and even showcases a bit of talent, if only for brief flashes.

Filled with pathetic attempts at humor, a nonsensical plot, terrible writing and directing, and mostly wooden acting, "The Starving Games" is the worst "film" I have ever seen. Never before has a comedy film failed to make me laugh. Do yourself a favor and watch anything else out there. It's bound to be better than this abomination (unless it's made by the same guys.)

1/10

I think it could of done a better job at being funnier as a parady of the hunger games, but it had some funny moments, it jus seemed a little bit childish at times. I liked the spoofs of characters from other movies like lord of the rings, harry potter and the expendables because they were pretty realistic,  and hilarious.  worth watching if ur in the mood for a goofy comedy, it will be hit or miss for most.. I just thought it was ok.
Everyone but Walt died sadly

I'm serious people. Dead f**king serious people. It's bad. It's really, really, really bad. Jason friedberg and Aaron Seltzer have made yet another fart feast filled with dated pop culture references, disguising and unfunny humor, and over the top nonsense, just they fill the theater with 13 year old's and hopping they get a quick buck out of it. Plus a lot of the actors they had are completely wasted in this and I felled so sorry for them half the time. Now I did laugh at least one or two times in this, but that's not saying much. This is still a very bad film that's I should suggest that you should stay out of it as soon as possible.

Not only is this one of the worst comedies I've ever seen, but it is also a complete insult to The Hunger Games license and it perfectly shows what is ugly and wrong about parody films and comedy, in general. Friedberg and Seltzer, for the love of god, stop making these movies! Stop it!
This movie is pretty much worthless...
has it moments but in all not a great movie
The movie had a few LOL moments but for the most part its like a lot of spoof movies where the jokes are expected or over the top. My favorite part would have to the bloopers at the end.

Even at just over 90 minutes, it feels like it lasted 3 hours.  Very little laughs here.
I HATED THIS MOVIE!!! It was so terrible I drop crap in the toilet every morning better than this!

I don't know what I was thinking when I decided to try and watch this film. Where the Scary Movie franchise at least had a few good laugh, this spoof (I refuse to call it comedy) is one of the worst movies I have ever seen and that says something considering the movies I've seen. (ex: Birdemic, Food Fight, Violent S**t 4) This movie has no humor, is filled with mindless and random pop culture references, and has just some of stupidest things that will make you turn off the movie, go to your bathroom, take a cold shower while still dressed crying your eyes out as you try to process the stupidity you just saw, take the movie, put it in a fireplace, let your dog pee on it, unload a mag of your colt 1911 on it, curse it with the Necronomicon, impale it with your lightsaber, call your friends and do a whole "Office Space printer-beat-up-montage" on it, setting it on fire, and giving it the good old one finger salute as it burns until finally crawling into your bed and curling up into the fetal position for about 4 hours.

I'm not going to lie, this is quite possibly my favorite low-budget parody film I've ever seen. Most of the jokes are on the money and catch you off guard just the way they're supposed to. And I'll be honest, even the acting was good. I've seen good actors try and act poorly before but this cast delivered. Speaking of the cast, Maiara Walsh is gorgeous. I hope she can break out of the low-budget niche film market and onto the big scene a bit because she's legit. If you're looking for a serious film, this obviously isn't for you but this is definitely a movie worth watching if you're looking for a cheap laugh or two or twelve.
This was pretty dumb and to think it was hilarious, it wasn't. The whole point of this movie was dumb overall.

Ever since my school district decided to pick the first book of the Hunger Games as a "One book one School" read I had this reaction to this book. Thankfully, someone (the makers of "The Starving Games") understood. I loved this movie.
Cheesy, but I was in the right mood to appreciate the humor
Funny, but with a few too many gross parts.
...and the trend of horrible crapfest that Hollywood has been trying to pass off as a spoof continues with this big steaming pile of donkey crap.
Darn you Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer. You guys never learn from your mistakes.
Probably the worst movie I've ever seen in my life.

One line summary: Brings new depth of meaning to the word inappropriate.

------------------------------------
The overall level of the humor is really low.  The pinata sequence, for instance, was stupid beyond belief.  The multiple references to excrement were not all that clever, nor were the endless product placements, nor were the face slaps to other movie franchises.  The obnoxious 12-year-old competitor who wanted to form an alliance with Kantmiss seemed more like a target.  The clip where the unarmed Kantmiss kills five armed opponents was ludicrous.

'When are they going to kill each other? I'm getting bored,' was the line that summarised the film for me.

Will there be a sequel to this satire?  Let us hope not.

-----Scores-----

    Cinematography: 6/10 Hand-held sequences were irritating as always, but most of the camera work was fine.

    Sound: 3/10 Besides the many leveling problems, the musical accompaniment was odd at best. 

    Acting: 2/10 

    Screenplay: 2/10 Well, it was a satire, so there was not much to expect.  I suppose the hundreds of continuity errors were intentional.  Finishing the film with a long set of bloopers just completed the implementation of 'who cares?'
"Darfur, Syria, New Jersey."
Pretty much what you would expect.  You have to be familiar with the story or you won't get half the jokes though.
Is enough for some laughs!
This is funny no joke

I thought it had quite a few good gags, very random. If you are irritated by the hunger games like me, you will love this movie mocking the whole thing!

I don't know why I bother with the director/writers of the new spoofs. I think it's because maybe they will hit a good spoof and make me laugh at least once but the more I watch, the more I feel like my IQ is dropping. Every joke is beyond dumb, the over the top stupidity of the attempt to make something work just doesnt. I feel these guys are worse then Uwe Boll and that is by far hard to do. At least Boll made one good movie that I can honestly say I enjoyed.

A comic and lame version of "The Hunger Games"? No, it's not "Divergent".  It is the mosly and sadly unfunny spoof of the hit movie franchise.  There is a rare and occasional laugh...not not many.

Kantmiss Evershot (Maiara Walsh) is chosen to represent District 12 in the annual starving games.  She will compete against all the other kids from other districts.

The plot is obviously the same as "The Hunger Games", but its approach is totally different.  I think the movie franchise is ripe for skewering, but it needs to be actually funny in the process.

(Okay, but not quite the best comedy film)
The Starving Games is a spoof of The Hunger Games obviously. There's ups and downs.
Lets start with the ups. The ups is that: It has comedy moments, it can be  funny at times, it has action contained within the comedy storyline, the acting is decent, the special effects and visual effects are both okay and the cinematography was good. The downs is that the comedy moments were not that great or strong. This is 40 is much better. The acting wasn't terrible, but it came off as fake here and there. So it's not one of those great films. It's just your average everyday film. This could be an independent film in my opinion.
The casting was unknown to me. I have not seen any of these cast members in any film except this one.

Sadly, this film doesn't rank high. It is as we all know it, a pretty low quality film. Laughs are here and there, but there is no wow performances. So all in all it gets a 2 and a half stars for the acting. But for everything else it's a 2 rating. My advice is rent it. But do not buy it. Sorry folks, but to me, this film is bad except for the film's moments of comedy and acting.

Terrible.

Help me. I can't stop laughing. Now, I am serious when I say that this movie is incredibly cheesy, but it has a lot of humor in it. Now, unlike my other review where I put it into a bunch of paragraphs, this one will only have three, and the third one starts right now.

How was the overall camerawork? Throughout the whole film, I was laughing way too hard, but I was able to keep up with every single camera shot.. In short, the camera work was adequate, but not really fit for a true comedic film. I think that there should have been clearer shots especially during the chase scenes, as there were too many blurs.

This is a fairly short review because I just laughed harder than I should have. If you are looking for a cheesy Hunger Games spoof, and you have a great sense of humor, this film is for you. Give it a try, and may the odds be never in your favor.

In the 1970's, Mel Brooks and Monty Python made spoof films a fixture in American movie theaters. In the years that have followed, we've even seen franchises like, Scary Movie, Date Movie, Epic Movie, and Superhero Movie, but when was the last time you saw a spoof that was actually any good? Because of my love of the Hunger Games, I actually gave it's spoof a chance and I'm sorry I did. There were a lot of things here that could have been made fun of, but they weren't. The film gets so desperate that they actually turn to Avatar, The Avengers, and the action star of the Expendables, to make the thing long enough to be a full length film. I understand that the purpose behind spoof films is to be so ridiculous, that people laugh at how stupid it is, but there is a point where it is so beyond stupid and childish, that no one finds it funny anymore. The Starving Games quickly crosses this line and doesn't go back. It's a comedy making fun of one of my favorite series of all-time, a series I know like the back of my hand, and I hardly laughed. The only thing this film does well is cast actors who closely resemble the cast of the Hunger Games franchise. Beyond that, the acting is terrible, the jokes wouldn't even make children laugh, and the story is so out there, that eventually you're not even sure what they are doing. While spoofing big movies has become big business, this one does nothing but annoy everyone who was dumb enough to watch it.

Review:

Round-Up:
As there dint that much out on DVD, I thought that I would give this movie a go, but I knew what to expect. I didn't really pay that much attention to the film after a whole because I just couldn't find anything funny. There are a few references to some other movies like The Avengers and The Expendables, but the director didn't do that much with the material. If you want loads of laughs then this is definitely not the movie for you, but if you want to play "Name That Film" then you should give it a go. A total waste of time and budget.

This has all of the problems of a Friedberg and Seltzer movie. There are too many references, too many poop jokes, too much product placement, and too little plot.

So why did I give it a 2?

Three reasons:

1. There is more violence in this movie than the actual Hunger Games movie
2. The love triangle is handled better here
3. There are glimpses of actual satire in this. One joke made me laugh out loud which is more I can say for most of the other comedies this year

I feel like lambasting the duo of Friedberg and Seltzer has gotten to the point of beating a dead horse. I've been railing against their misbegotten sense of comedy (really just pointless and soon-to-be-dated pop-culture references) for years, declaring three of their terrible spoof movies as my worst film of that year. There is no love lost between me and these two men, and yet I feel the sense to restrain my ire when it comes to their latest, The Starving Games. It's another witless comedy caper, this time using the popular Hunger Games series as its skeleton to hang its desperate jokes upon. These guys don't know what parody is, don't know the particulars of comedy and how to build and payoff a joke. It's the same pattern of ineptitude that will never change. Yet while sitting through all 80 laborious minutes of Starving Games, I felt like Friedberg and Seltzer have come to the realization that the end is nigh for their spoof careers. This last movie didn't get a theatrical release and the production values look chintzy even for them. They used to crank these lousy films out one a year; hell, in 2008 they gave us two. Now they've released two in the last five years. Usually they'll pack a celebrity or, barring that, MadTV alums. Even those are absent. That's right, even this movie couldn't snag a MadTV alum or D-list celeb. Perhaps, as I'd long prayed, the public has grown sour on Friedberg and Seltzer's misunderstanding of comedy and matured enough to realize that pointless references are not the same as parody. In all fairness, I did laugh two times in The Starving Games, both related to Diedrich Bader as President Snowballs. The lead actress, Maiara Walsh, displays a lot of potential. She's a good comic actress, has a tremendous smile, a memorable face, and sturdy poise to slough through this mess. She deserves a better movie and more opportunities.

At this point, you know what you're getting with Friedberg and Seltzer, and that's all you're going to get. However, I just looked online and discovered they have two movies scheduled for release next year, one a Fast and Furious parody (goody), and the other an honest to God spoof-free straight comedy. I'll be fascinated to see what these two have to offer when it comes to non-spoof comedy, but their background fills me with equal parts dread and derisive excitement. Hey, it can't be worse than InAPPropriate Comedy, could it?

This spoof or parody written and directed by Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer, creators of other similar "works of art" can easily fulfil the criteria for the "Worst films of the year". Not many things in this movie were funny, and some of them will make you cry - how low can they go! In this film I could recognize The Hunger Games, Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows - Part 2, Sherlock Holmes - A Game of Shadows, The Avengers, Avatar, The Great and Powerful Oz, The Hobbit - An Unexpected Journey and The Expendables... but I wish I didn't. This was a movie made on a lowest possible budget: it was around $4.5 million dollars, and the shooting lasted only one month! 

It kind of goes without saying that the writing and direction here is abysmal, with the only bit of coherency coming from the viewer's prior knowledge of The Hunger Games... If you like to lower your IQ, and to be annoyed by bits in the movie that aren't satirizing the source material, instead merely pointing at it and saying, "Hey, remember this?" - watch it! I already wasted too many words on this... enough.
Now I understand why I never watch any of these spoof movies. There were some parts that made me laugh but overall it was gratuitous and stupid.
it's exactly what you would expect from a Friedberg/Seltzer film...just another hit-and-mostly-miss comedy film with little to no brain used in viewing [C]

As with all their movies, this was another completely unfunny film that had a far better looking cast than the real Hunger Games. Bonus points there, but holy God... why are these people allowed to put this crap out!?!? I have actually farted funnier lines!

Okay, I'm not gonna lie. Yes, it does have some funny moments in there, but an endless amount of pop-culture references (including the movie they're parodying), and gross-out and very subpar humour outweigh the rest of the film.

At this point among filmdom (or whatever you choose call it film planet, film world, film committee, etc.) it's common knowledge to avoid anything by the duo of Aaron Seltzer and Jason Friedberg. These two greatest contribution to cinema have always the years they didn't release a film. Unfortunately at this point in these the duo along with the people giving them jobs refuse to use their brains make a competent comedy.

The Starving Game is about Kantmiss Evershot fighting for her life in the 75th annual Starving Games. Like the duo previous films its plagues with the same issues; outdated film references, no comedic consequences, no pacing, non existence plot, absent of characters, to stupid to make fun of, beating a dead horse with every joke, and wasting the audience time. That's the whole film in a nutshell, but where it fails the most is being a basic parody of "The Hunger Games". It does not understand the definition of the word parody. That would have been asking to much from the writers who predict Lady Gaga will become president in the future. Instead of poking fun the film "shaky cam" by simply having a film crew capturing the action why not make a semi-political allegory on the Hollywood system downgrading intellectual properties. Then again, asking for actual minimal effort from the writers that only use "The Expendables" and "The Avengers" as throwaway gags instead of actual participants is a bit too much to expect. Now that I think about it that would have been a whole lot better, but who am I to judge the brilliance of movie where Kantmiss missing Peter as a giant cake next to her in the middle of the woods. Well to the writers credit they did copy the stupidity of that scene from the actual movie...though that's not a good thing either since it had no punch line in its delivery. Much like the film structure it seems my brains cells were not present in this paragraph. 

Narratively how does it all play out? If you seen "The Hunger Games" try to imagine the same plot points only brain dead slowly killing your brain cells being filled with unfunny overused jokes. Kantmiss offers herself to participate in the Starving Games (although everyone looks well fed, another miss point to satirize), Kantmiss faking her romance with Peter, underdeveloped little girl who helps Kantmiss gets kicked to death (let that sink in), underdeveloped romance, Kantmiss and Peter in a standoff finale. Talk about being uncreative stealing directly from the source material this duo is "satirizing". I will admit this film did make me laugh one time with a fake commercial for a hamburger (a mixture of pizza, ice cream, buns, vegetables, and other things). However, that joke is soon forgotten when M.I.A. appearce play the earrape known as "Sexy and I Know It" and the I don't understand humanity anymore popularity of Gangnam Style being killed off. Not that these musical references (including Taylor Swift) have no comedic purpose other than being completely superficial to the film just like its creation. Filled with incoherent sight gags, fart jokes, pointless pop culture references, and anything you could imagine from a duo set on destroying any fiber of humor. At least the acting talent despite being given awful material are okay. Diedrich Bader, bless him, who despite the godawful material he's given, still commits to his every line. Likewise, star Maiara Walsh has brief glimpses of talent, but they're usually spoiled a few seconds later by whatever cheap trick the movie has her doing next (like bird poop being thrown at her).

The Starving Game like it title will suggest leaves it does not fill its audience stomach for comedy. Saying this is for the lowest common denominator is an insult to the lowest common denominator. Even at under 83 minutes it fails to have enough material to support itself let alone entertain an audience. In vein of a bad rehashed sequel the duo rinse and repeats every mistakes they committed unable to comprehend the basics of how comedy works.

Cannot give 0, but if ever a  movie deserved it, this is the one.  Completely unimaginative and not funny at all.  Jokes are grossly outdated in some instances and in others, the actors are trying too hard to get the laugh.  The movie as a whole tried way too hard to make light of a film most people love and it does not accomplish that goal.  What is does accomplish: spoofing every movie of the last year to some extent, even if only for literally a brief second, and not in a successful way.  Credit goes to the look-alike characters, some are indistinguishable from their counterparts.  Overall, a 0/5 and a movie i would recommend no one waste money on like i did.  This movie needs to die and soon.
